title: Ticket #3655: restarting procd on failure doesn't retry correctly
description: The latest changes to the code for #3618 prevent restarting the procd in an infinite loop when the daemon can't establish a connection to the restarted procd. However, if procd startup fails early (before it closes the stderr pipe back to the parent), we will EXCEPT and not actually retry as many times as intended. And perhaps EXCEPT is not the best course of action in general for this case.
